meanings.definition: A type of musical texture in which multiple voices or instruments perform variations of the same melody simultaneously.
meanings.sent1: In heterophony, different instruments play the melody in their own way at the same time.
meanings.sent2: The concert showcased beautiful heterophony as each musician added their unique twist to the melody.
meanings.sent3: At the music festival, the heterophony of the band made the audience tap their feet in delight.
meanings.sent4: The symphony of heterophony painted a colorful musical canvas for the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of heterophony lies in the harmonious blend of diverse musical interpretations.

meanings.definition: The simultaneous variation of a single melody by multiple performers.
meanings.sent1: During the performance, the choir demonstrated heterophony by singing the same tune with individual flair.
meanings.sent2: The folk ensemble captivated the audience with their enchanting heterophony of a traditional song.
meanings.sent3: The school play had a hilarious moment when the actors unintentionally created heterophony while singing.
meanings.sent4: The street musicians created a magical atmosphere with their spontaneous heterophony.
meanings.sent5: The magic of heterophony is like a musical kaleidoscope, each performer adding a unique color to the melody.
